titleStmt.title: Epigrams both pleasant and serious, written by that all-worthy knight, Sir Iohn Harrington: and neuer before printed
titleStmt.author: Harington, John, Sir, 1560-1612.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted [by George Purslowe] for Iohn Budge, and are to be sold at his shoppe at the south dore of Pauls, and at Britaines Burse,

notesStmt.note: In this edition, A2r last line begins "presumes"; C1r, epigram 34, line 1 has "and".
Identified as STC 12775 on UMI microfilm reel 1070.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University. Library.
Cropped at head; F4 partly in pen facsimile.

place.placeName: his shoppe at the south dore of Pauls
